race.name: Terrados Unicorn
entries: You gain the following traits.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1, and your Charisma score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Unicorns reach maturity at around 12 to 15 months similar to normal horses, though they can live to be up to 100 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Unicorns lean towards true neutral, focusing on personal survival and those closest to them as they would in the wild.

entries.name: Size
entries: 5'6 Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 30 feet. You can walk 60ft in a round in your natural form.

entries.name: Natural Form
entries: As long as you have your horn you can transform between your natural and humanoid form instead of moving that round.

entries.name: Horn
entries: In your natural form you can use a charge attack with your horn for 1d8+strength damage to one creature and pushing them back five feet for every 5 points they beat the creature's AC by.

entries.name: Natural Healing
entries: As long as you have your horn you can use lay on hands for up to 30 HP a day.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Common, Horse.

race.name: Wolfen
entries: You gain the following traits.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1, and your Wisdom score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Wolfens go out to find their companion at 13 years of age, reach full physical maturity at the age of 17 and live to about 100, possibly significantly more if they bond to a particularly long lived companion.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: The most common alignment for Wolfens is Lawful, though where they fall on the rest of the spectrum varies wildly.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Wolfens have keen senses usually only found in the animal kingdom, with this comes the ability to see in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dual Minded
entries: Because of the nature of their souls being bound to another creature, Wolfens get advantage on Wisdom saving throws as a reaction.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Wolfens deal 1d4 slashing+ Strength modifier damage with their unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Companion
entries: A Wolfen's animal companion is different from your average animal. They are the other half of a Wolfen's soul and personality. While a Companion could be left at home they provide needed balance to the usually extreme personalities of Wolfens. Benefiting from the bond as much or even more than the Wolfen themselves might. The first and most clear advantage is the life expectancy of the companion or Wolfen grows to match that of the one who would naturally live the longest. A Companion otherwise behaves as a Ranger's Companion, you must choose a creature of CR 1/4 or lower, though a large size creature that otherwise fits these requirements can be chosen.

entries.name: Broken Bond
entries: A Wolfen who's bound companion dies must make a DC20 Wisdom saving throw or become stunned as a feeling of half their soul being ripped from them overtakes them. They may make additional saves every hour, or if the source of the death is nearby, every round. A Wolfen who makes the saving throw can then take a week to learn how to transform into their lost companion twice per long rest and behaves as if it were a Druid's Wild Shape.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Common, Wolfen

entries.name: Reptilian Bond
entries: Your skin has toughened with scales. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor

entries.name: Avian Bond
entries: Whether it's a sonorous voice or brightly colored feathers, you stand out in a crowd and have the confidence to perform under pressure, granting you proficiency in Performance

entries.name: Feline Bond
entries: Your bond with your feline companion has granted you agility and flexibility not found in other Wolfens, granting you proficiency in Acrobatics

entries.name: Canine Bond
entries: A canine nose is one of the sharpest in the animal kingdom, granting Advantage to perception when smelling

entries.name: Arachnid Bond
entries: Small hairs have grown on the tips of your fingers, giving you a 10 foot climb speed and allowing you to manipulate spider's webs without getting caught in them.

entries.name: Aquatic Bond
entries: You have developed fins and a large flat tail, granting you a Swim speed of 30 feet

entries.name: Rodent Bond
entries: Your companion's uncanny ability to move quickly and unseen while fitting into tight spaces has rubbed off on you, granting you proficiency in Stealth.

entries.name: Equine Bond
entries: Your bond with your companion has granted you powerful legs that grant you an extra 5 feet of movement speed.

entries.name: Venomous Bond
entries: Your connection with your venomous companion has given your body the same defense mechanism adding 1d4 Poison damage to your natural attacks

entries.name: Insectoid Bond
entries: You have become developing a chitinous hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 12 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Bat Bond
entries: You have developed sensitive ears that allow you to echo locate, giving you proficiency in Perception into small spaces without revealing yourself.

entries.name: Mustalid Bond
entries: Your body has started exuding a natural and powerful musk. Giving you disadvantage on Stealth rolls, but advantage on Intimidation rolls

race.name: Panthris
entries: You gain the following traits.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1, and your Strength score increases by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Panthris reach maturity at 18 years old and will often live to be 100 or more barring the unforeseen.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Panthris are most often Chaotic Good, they live freely but are prone to helping others when it is called for.

entries.name: Size
entries: 6'0 Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base speed is 30 feet. You have a climb speed of 30 feet

entries.name: Advanced Darkvision
entries: Living in the deepest parts of the world gives priority to evolving the ability to see naturally in the dark. You can see in the dark as if it were bright light up to 90 feet. You can see normally in dim light. However, bright light hurts your eyes and will dazzle you.

entries.name: Underground Stalker
entries: Panthris can move unhindered through difficult terrain while underground.

entries.name: Cave Lungs
entries: Panthris can hold their breath for a number of rounds equal to four times their Constitution score before risking drowning or suffocating.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Panthris have sharp claws that deal {@dice 1d4} slashing damage+ strength with their unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Panthris. You can speak common brokenly but cannot read or write in it without additional study.
